intro: Luerella pelecaniceps, commonly known as the pelecaniceps luerella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded forest environments.
